content:
The global font can be set with css: 

* {  	font-size: 10pt !important;   	font-family: Cambria, serif !important; }


or e.g. Open Sans, sans-serif

Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, create a new folder named chrome, create a new document in chrome with a text editor, name it userChrome.css, Save as type: All files *.*, copy in the above code, change the size and font as desired. Double-click toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets to true in Settings/General/Config. editor, restart TB.

Online css generator

video: How to create a css file (Firefox or TB)

What further information would be useful?
creator: daniel_f

content:
Try again in troubleshooting mode. That will disable all addons and that may show where the problem is. I also use win 11 with no difficulties. VPNs and antivirus products also sometimes interfere. Just last week, a major interference by Bitdefender was confirmed by the vendor.

Personal suggestion: if your business relies on specific software, I suggest waiting at least six months prior to using any major update and also to provide a simple test base for every upgrade that you allow. One good tool for that is the portable version that allows easy testing on the same PC as used for production. Maybe I'm too cautious, but my career has been in software and few updates go perfectly.

content:
Staat alles zoals beschreven op helppagina van proximus; Stel je e-mailaccount in of kijk de instellingen na: 

   Open Thunderbird    Klik op  Accountinstellingen > Accountacties >  E-mailaccount toevoegen ;    Vul je naam, e-mailadres en wachtwoord in. Klik op Doorgaan ;    Kies Imap en vervolgens Handmatig configureren     Vul de velden in zoals hieronder beschreven:        Inkomende mail:            Server: imap.proximus.be            Port: 993            Encrypton method: SSL/TLS            Authentificatie: normaal wachtwoord        Uitgaande mail:            Server: relay.proximus.be            Port: 587            Encrypton method: STARTTLS            Authentificatie : normaal wachtwoord            Gebruikersnaam: je e-mail    Er verschijnt een waarschuwingsbericht. Accepteer en maak de account aan

Heeft u een firewall actief, zoja zet deze dan even uit om te testen of dat het probleem is

content:
If the Junk folder is acting like an Inbox, you can probably fix it with this add-on:

https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-us/thunderbird/addon/folderflags/

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1460237
creator: sfhowes

content: Thanks for your reply. I have installed FolderFlags and the folder in question has two flags; inbox and junk. Which one do I delete please? When I have deleted whichever flag I need to, will I be able to delete this duplicate folder. Likewise can I delete the duplicate BT Internet junk folder.
creator: nngbarraclough

content:
The Junk folder should only have a junk flag. When TB restarts, there should only be a single (Hotmail) Junk folder.

I don't know why you see duplicates, unless you have both TB's Junk Controls and the mail provider's spam/junk filters enabled. I would employ one or the other, but not both.
creator: sfhowes

content: For your second question, it is possible to add multiple email accounts in Thunderbird, including Gmail accounts. After adding your first email account, you can go to New Account -> Email to add any additional email accounts that are needed.

Mojave is supported by Thunderbird ESR 115, but nothing newer https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/115.0/system-requirements/

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)

content:
I'm not having that problem, but here are my settings. How do they compare with yours?

IMAP: Server name: imap.comcast.net Port: 993 user name: my Comcast email address connection security: SSL/TLS authentication method: Normal password

SMTP: Server Name: smtp.comcast.net Port: 465 User Name: my Comcast email address Connection Security: SSL/TLS Authentication method: Normal password

=======

You could try deleting your passwords for those servers from the password manager (Settings | Privacy & Security | Saved Passwords,) after which you should be prompted to input it again. I recently discovered that there were some leftover entries there that referenced old credentials - they weren't causing a problem for me, but maybe they are for you? I deleted them anyway.

I recently had a problem with another email account, not Comcast, where my mail stopped working in Thunderbird. I eventually deleted the account and re-added it, letting Thunderbird choose the settings from its database. That revealed that the provider had changed their settings without letting me know. It works now. I would not want to do that with Comcast because I have years and years worth of mail that it would take forever to download again, but if all else failed, I might resort to that.

content: Uploading to IMAP is problematic, as IMAP was never designed for high volumen uploads. I suggest creating a manual filter that selects all messages in a folder and COPIES (not moves) to an online folder. Don't delete the local copies until you verify that the copy was successful.
creator: davidsk

content:
You can find all Thunderbird releases here https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/

However I don't know for sure that your data (profile) can be downgraded from 142 to 128.

Before you attempt to downgrade, you should ( MUST ) backup your current profile first.

content:
Open a Run window (Windowskey+R) and enter the following:

"C:\Program Files\folder with TB 128ESR\thunderbird.exe" --allow-downgrade -p

and choose the profile that was created in 142.

content:
Vai in Menu > Impostazioni > Generale cerca la sezione Centro account e togli la spunta da Crea account nel nuovo Centro account

Questo attiverà la vecchia procedura di creazione degli account -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/configurazione-automatica-account che offre anche l'opzione di configurazione manuale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/configurazione-manuale-account

Se anche in questo modo si blocca, netti Thunderbird offline prima di avviare la procedura di creazione dell'account Premi Alt sulla tastiera per rendere visibile la barra dei menu, poi vai in File > Non in linea > Lavora non in linea

creator: davidsk

content:
Some thoughts...

- Re-start Thunderbird, or even better, reboot the computer. There could a memory leak in Thunderbird or one of its extensions, or something else running on the computer, leaving programs memory-starved.

- It could be a corrupted search index. Quit Thunderbird and delete the file global-messages-db.sqlite in your profile. Thunderbird will recreate the index on restart (though this could take a long time.)

- Compact the folder(s.) That can sometimes sort out some minor corruption. Best to make a backup of your profile first.
